intro: Hieracium infrasericatum, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange flower heads that consist of many small florets, and its leaves are often hairy and deeply lobed. Hieracium infrasericatum is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in some regions.
